No, sadly. I just want to know if Aphrodite is habitable for a potential series I am making.

> 
> No, sadly. I just want to know if Aphrodite is habitable for a potential series I am making.

Aphrodite doesn't have oxygen.

The following planets contain oxygen:

\* Osiris System: Volco, a moon of Isus

\* Abbadon System: Nix and Violetta

\* Eravate System: Eden

\* Gargantua System: Mann's Planet and Miller's Planet

> 
> I did this... It's a terra class planet with a green sky and purple clouds around a red and white gas giant...
> [http://i.imgur.com/dLwe5ca.png](http://i.imgur.com/dLwe5ca.png)
> 
> Oh and this too...
>

> JR

Question, how to add all those stars in the background? Last time I used Kerbal Galaxy the skies were all black, which is freaking me out frankly.

> 
> Question, how to add all those stars in the background? Last time I used Kerbal Galaxy the skies were all black, which is freaking me out frankly.

Delete the Skybox textures in GameData/TextureReplacer/Default. There might also be some in GameData/TextureReplacer/EnvMap.

> 
> Delete the Skybox textures in GameData/TextureReplacer/Default. There might also be some in GameData/TextureReplacer/EnvMap.

Seriousely? you dont like the fact that intergalactic space is dark?

Is anyone running this with [Distant Object Enhancement](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98943) and / or [Atmospheric Scatterer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115408-WIP-Scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-%28v0-0171-18-07-2015%29-Kept-you-waiting-huh)?

Using these (or one of them) causes a flood of "NullReference Exception" entries in my GameLog quite often. It works in general, but for unknown reasons it goes ham regularly.

> 
> Is anyone running this with [Distant Object Enhancement](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98943) and / or [Atmospheric Scatterer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115408-WIP-Scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-%28v0-0171-18-07-2015%29-Kept-you-waiting-huh)?
> Using these (or one of them) causes a flood of "NullReference Exception" entries in my GameLog quite often. It works in general, but for unknown reasons it goes ham regularly.

Ikr? I've been trying for a while!

> 
> Seriousely? you dont like the fact that intergalactic space is dark?

Daniel l. , not everybody likes to have a (nearly) black skybox. As I said, it should be optionnal, but that's Artyomka15's choice. 

I'm also pretty sure in intergalactic space, you would see lots and lots of galaxies, as the stars aren't blocking them.
[daniel l.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/59475-daniel-l), When will you be able to give me your system for tests?
How am I supposed to land on Nix, its atmosphere is too thin?

> 
> How am I supposed to land on Nix, its atmosphere is too thin?

If the atmosphere is too thin for chutes to work, well...just do a powered landing like on the Mun!

Why does Mann's planet have oxygen? In the movie the atmosphere is mainly ammonia.

Also when will you add Pantagruel and it's planet Edmunds?

I must report that, unfortunately, I'm experiencing a screen of stars rather than the space center upon opening a save. (How much you wanna bet the issue's Texture Replacer?)

EDIT: Got it. The solution, for anyone experiencing this problem, is to dump the contents into your GameData folder such that the EVE config's in /GameData/KerbalGalaxy.

EDIT 2: Er ... it's a bit more confusing. Not too horrible, though.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T12:59:47Z" title="08/13/2015 12:59  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by Whovian**

> Hope you like it!

I just tested the system. It seems to work pretty well, but isn't Minos supposed to have Oceans?
In the Science of Interstellar book, it is revealed that Pantagruel is actually a Black hole with about 10,000 solar masses, and the radius of Earth.

Quick question. I bumped into a minor problem with getting another pair of planet packs to work with one another, and I realized that adding another two wormholes would fix the issue. Is it possible to add more wormholes with destinations other than the Gargantua system? Poking around configs suggests no, but perhaps I missed something.

> 
> I just tested the system. It seems to work pretty well, but isn't Minos supposed to have Oceans?

Quick question: I am trying to change the name of the central black hole. How would I go about this?

> 
> Quick question: I am trying to change the name of the central black hole. How would I go about this?

 Don't try it. It's still the stock Sun, renaming it causes issues.
